7) Ranking Heuristics (Simple, Transparent)
• Recency first, then tag overlap, then token frequency in summary/preview.
• Prefer items with explicit `final: true` or higher version numbers in title.
• Cap per-node reads (e.g., 3–5 items) to stay fast and friendly.
8) Operations
Node operator:
• Run exporter on a schedule; rotate nonce; prune old nonces.
• Keep `public` field accurate; redact sensitive content before export.
• Update node entry in the global index if repo path changes.
Directory host:

• Accept pull requests to add nodes; basic format validation only.
• Optional: nightly CI to verify entry URLs are reachable.
9) Privacy / Safety
• No personal identifiers or secrets in public mirror.
• Nonce URLs are hard to guess; rotate to revoke.
• For stronger control later: signed URLs (HMAC) or gated relay with CAPTCHA.
• Clear license/terms in each repo to prevent misuse.
10) Roadmap
Phase 1 (Weeks): Single-node (yours) + small public index (lists only your node).
Phase 2: Multi-node index; minimal CI checks; basic ranking across nodes.
Phase 3: Optional NL ‘memory chat’ front-end; auto-ingest from assistants; signed URL
option.
Phase 4: Federation (multiple mirrors of the index) and optional peer discovery.
11) Minimal Deliverables to Start
• Your node mirror (nonce-only) with search map, shards, chunks (already built).
• An `index.json` in a tiny Git repo that lists your node’s entry URL.
• A short ‘How ChatGPT uses the index’ note (already embedded in this doc).
